title: The New Fiddlesticks Design
body:

https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-hx7sJaxOxBA/Xac_T8qjJcI/AAAAAAABZ2k/lTmkctyWUDcg5spAddEb937w2c3IMO90ACLcBGAsYHQ/s1600/OIh9Pe5.gif

I just have a few questions:

Why make Fiddlesticks semi-mechanical instead of wooden? Is there a reason to stray away from the wooden structure? Why the saw-blade on his shoulder? Does his elongated claw-arm play any part of his gameplay kit? Same thing goes for his scythe? Why keep the point-and-click status?

What dance will he have knowing he has that kind of arm dragging behind him? How will the arm affect his skins? Has the champion theme been made yet? If not, may I recommend Sons of Perdition (they make death country music and they composed the music for the short: Backwater Gospel)?

There's a lot I wanna ask, but I feel that you don't want to answer everything just yet. All I can say is keep up the good work! This is looking pretty gnarly!

replies.body: On the whole mechanical thing, well the most obvious answer is "to make him look more edgy and cool". But maybe, just maybe, they are considering making him melee, since a scythe wielding champ that doesn't use it is pretty goofy. Maybe they want to convey the fact that he's gonna shred you up rather than hit you with litle green dots.
Well all the metal bits appear to be farming implements, so it makes sense.

I hope they do something with the scythe in the update, it's just so weird being there and he's never used it. So if he has some kind of attack that uses it or having him melee and his autos use it would be cool
Isn't he a mage? From what I know, most, or if not all, mages are ranged.

That's too limiting a categorization I think. There are champs like Galio/Sylas/Kassadin/Ekko who are essentially mage/x hybrids, and itemize like mages. The whole melee thing has to do more with visual cohesion. If a character has a huge ass scythe then you expect them to use it to slash people up. Imagine Aatrox coming in with that sword and only using his fists instead. Although if they have to make him ranged, they could make it so his AAs produce slashing projectiles.

But all those you mentioned have hybrid roles. Ekko and Kassadin are assassins, Galio can be a tank, Sylas is a skirmisher/diver. When we are talking about pure mage, I don't think there is a single champion that is melee. Mages are supposed to be immobile, deal ap damage, offer some cc/utility, have some aoe ability, be heavily dependent on ability than auto (Azir may be an exception, but he has a secondary marksman tag) and not have tank stats (other than Vladimir), so in the laning phase, in order to be able to cs and not be completely overpowered by assassins, they must have the range advantage over them to poke them. Assassins on the other hand can close the gap from being poked, and deal burst damage that will devastate any squishy. Items don't reallly mean much.

Yeah that's why I usually don't like using class categorizations. If you design a game on that limiting a system, where every champion is allowed to have a very narrow selection of traits according to their class then you end up with few directions you can push your champs towards. Fid is going to be a primarily jungling mage, so theoretically being melee wouldn't hurt him as much and would make it more clear how he's supposed to be played. But, well, we'll have to wait and see I guess.
It might also be because he's supposed to be myth of fear from various cultures. Farmer from Noxus might imagine a head of scarecrow while Pilties might imagine mechanical aparature.

They also said on the Roadmap:

> "Experienced Fiddlesticks players will wreak mental havoc on their victims as they question what is real and what is merely a terrifying effigy."

This looks to me like Fiddlesticks will have some kind of copy/clone mechanic, letting him create images of himself to psyche out opponents and keep them on edge.

I think he will leave a lot of still clones of himself around the map, so he'll be able to pose as one of them, for ambushes and mind games. Clones will need to inflict some kind of penalty to their attackers though, else every ranged champ will just auto to check if real of fake.

Maybe he can leave effigies around the map and can use a channeled ability to teleport to them. That way, even after the initial fright of realizing the effigy isnt Fiddlesticks, the enemy still knows that that might not be true the next time they look at that effigy.

You all hit on everything we've been thinking in this thread <3

Another note on the metal - the twisting, creaking and scraping sounds and that sound of a wire under tension are things that I thought would make a really creepy sound palette! I’m a huge fan of this rework so far and can’t wait to see gameplay.

Can't say I like the mechanical hand he's holding.

I like the silhouette of it and the twitchiness is fine, I just think they could have done something more interesting.

I love the metal bits of him. Makes it feel like whatever fiddle's true form is just ripped apart farming equipment to make it. Also adds more weight and power to him. I love current fiddle, but it looks like you can snap him in two with a little effort.

I think the reason for the mechanical bits is to make him look more menacing.
Metal is unnatural, cold and lifeless. Its one of mankinds best tools to inflict pain upon others and the mere idea of getting pierced by rusty metal is already unnerving. It also adds to the idea that this form is just a mere puppet, it is literally a machine, a tool, that was created for/by whatever lurks beneath that cloak.

Not to mention that it makes him look more powerful too, old Fiddlesticks might have been spooky, but he looked like you could easily snap him.

They might also plan to link him to Zaun/Piltover and the metal is an easy indicator for that. In general I think that Zaun/Piltover as a faction for him would have allowed the most creative freedom since the machinelike design instantly reminds us of this place, regardless of how the rest looks.

It actually looks pretty terrible. Nothing about it retains the goofy aspects of Fiddle. This seems to be a trend with Riot where they rework champs and in the process they totally lose what made that champion a memorable character. It's pretty tragic. Looks like a tree/dinosaur hybrid that was made by someone told to make it appeal to as many 13-15 year olds as possible. Then again, I'm not really surprised that they butchered his identity. By moving him out of the support role you're basically saying fuck you to the current playerbase of fiddle (who by and large play him as a support and where he currently sits at a perfect 50% win rate). Betray the playerbase, obliterate his identity, as long as it broadens his appeal to sell more skins, right? These red posts saying "his abilities still retain some of his goofy aspects!" He was goofy in the way that he walked and how ridiculous he felt to play, not because Crowstorm (which I'm assuming the Reds are referring to as part of his goofy identity) was fun to use and got a chuckle out of the person using it. 

Bot lane is already a bore fest with everyone having a 1 shot hook. So we get Yumi, a flying cat on a book with an awful pun for a name, and an ADC support (?) that no one asked for. And they're moving an interesting, fun, silly, albeit outdated support to the jungle because that's where all the edgelords are.

Except Fiddlesticks was never a silly character to begin with. Not in his lore. Not in his gameplay. Never. Nowhere was he ever portrayed as silly.

In the old lore, he was a monster summoned by a Summoner in the IoW, who he immediately killed. He then killed anyone who entered the room and basically became the executioner, because they had no idea what to do with him because they couldn't control him.

In the new lore, he was a farmer who was blamed for a famine that plagued his village and subsequently brutally murdered by everyone in the village. He then came back as a possessed scarecrow, and again killed anyone who entered his domain.

You probably have a really fucked up sense of humor if you think Fiddlesticks, the fucking harbinger of doom, is a silly character.

The rework is just turning him into what Riot intended him to be from the beginning, which is a horror icon.
